history.text: Hello, I enjoy action movies, what about you?
hi!
hello!
well, I'm more of a drama fan
but Action movies will do if they're well-made
Typically, I don't watch action movies but the ones I have seen have been entertaining.
I think Iron Man, for instance, was one of them
This movie seemed to have a good cast of actors and that can make a huge difference in the success of a film.
yeah, you're right
the casting was really great
and it really made a difference
Robert Downey Jr was PERFECT for the role of Tony Stark

I think the part in the critical response that discusses how the film felt like a military thriller. That makes it a little different than a typical action movie that is just full of action and special effects.
and of course, let us not forget the legendary JJeff Bridges as Stane
yes, you're absolutely right
it didn't feel like a heavily-CGI'ed movie
This might be a movie I might want to check out. It seems like you don't need to have too much prior knowledge of the comic or storyline to enjoy the movie
Based on the ratings, I can understand why they went on to make sequels
When going to the movies, do you base your decision on ratings?
yeah, Marvel movies are completely liberated from the comics; meaning, u don't need any knowledge of them at all
Oh! yes, I do
especially Rotten Tomatoes
I haven't had as much experience with ratings but I have found that rotten tomatoes and other viewer ratings are more trustworthy vs more professional movie critics.
do you think the 94% of Rotten Tomatoes is a fair rating for this movie?

I think so. I think society in general is really into this type of movie and movie makers are putting the necessary time and money into them to make the interesting. This one seems to have a really good plot line with a deep storyline and I think that makes a big difference.
exactly, the depth of the plot really made this one stand out
do you think Superhero movies have a bright future
or do you think she should be stopped already, due to their repetitive nature?

Honestly, back in 2008, I'd say yes. However, I feel like 10 years later, there have been so many sequels and additions that it's starting to wear out it's welcome a bit unless it's a new storyline and new characters
I can sense that you're the kind of person who enjoyed Logan
I know I am hahaha

Didn't see that one. I saw the first couple of that storyline though. My husband will watch them and it depends on whether I feel like joining in or not. I know he's watched Iron Man and the sequels though.
The storyline of this movie seems to be getting very action packed! I like that he admits who he is so it isn't a secret like some of the other superhero movies.
yeah, that's very interesting
he doesn't hide his real identity like the others
Oh! BTW! I highly recommend watching Logan, you will love it
This discussion would be a lot easier if I had seen this movie! ha
Thanks. Will do.
it's unlike any superhero movie you've ever seen
Oh! guess that's it
what was your favorite part of this movie?
it was nice talking to you
likewise!
